page.title: 08 SHORNE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Shorne village hall is in the centre of the village. It has become a place where the people of the village can meet and has been responsible for making the village such a close community. The village hall is used every day and by about 90 per cent of the villagers. Various clubs and societies use the hall including; ballet, playgroup,youth club, badminton, Darby and Joan, local history, Dickens society and flower arranging. The hall is run by a committee who organise fund raising activities. In 1978 the hall was greatly extended to cater for the growing population in the village. It is now used by young and old and is very much the centrepiece of the village.
